meanings.definition: Writing or speaking in a dull, ordinary manner.
meanings.sent1: The book had a prosing style that made it hard to stay interested.
meanings.sent2: Her prosing tone during the presentation put everyone to sleep.
meanings.sent3: The prosing speech at the meeting made people yawn.
meanings.sent4: His prosing writing lacked any spark of creativity.
meanings.sent5: The prosing dialogue in the movie was forgettable.

meanings.definition: To write or speak in a dull, ordinary manner.
meanings.sent1: She kept prosing on about the same topic without any excitement.
meanings.sent2: He tends to prosing whenever he is asked to give a speech.
meanings.sent3: The teacher prosed on for hours about grammar rules.
meanings.sent4: The politician was prosing about the economy without any real solutions.
meanings.sent5: I could hear him prosing in the background, but I couldn't make out the words.
